title: Westfalenstadion - Wikipedia
snippet: The city of Dortmund, initially burdened with 6 million DM, only had to pay 800,000 DM, and quickly profited from the stadium's high revenues. On 2 April 1974, Borussia Dortmund officially moved into their new home and has played in the Westfalenstadion ever since.

title: Borussia Dortmund - Wikipedia
snippet: The stadium currently hosts up to 81,359 spectators (standing and seated) for league matches and 65,829 seated spectators for international matches. For these, the characteristic southern grandstand is re-equipped with seats to conform to FIFA regulations. In 1974, the Westfalenstadion replaced ...

title: Borussia Dortmund Stadium | Signal Iduna Park | Football Ground Guide
snippet: A guide to Borussia Dortmund stadium, the Signal Iduna Park which is also known as the Westfalenstadion and is home to the famous Yellow Wall

title: Stadium Guide: Westfalenstadion (Borussia Dortmund) | Jobs In Football
snippet: Officially titled Signal Iduna Park due to sponsorship reasons and referred to as BVB Stadion Dortmund during UEFA competitions (such as the Champions League), Westfalenstadion is the biggest stadium in Germany, with a total capacity that exceeds ...

title: Signal Iduna Park (2025) - All You Need to Know BEFORE You Go (with Reviews)
snippet: This is one to check off, visit this stadium during a game. The whole city is walking around in yellow, everyone is cozy and everywhere puppet tents for a snack and a drink. At the stadium everyone goes into the stadium on the same side, this can cause some crowds, but there are also all people clearly present to help with questions.
